author: jgm
content:
> Can anyone just launch the contract?
<@!276099850918166529> They can launch _a_ contract.  The address of the contract used by the chain is part of its specification, so just creating a contract at an arbitrary address won't do any good.

author: jgm
content: Yes, but the general point is that random people creating deposit contracts won't help because until the address is enshrined in the specification there is no way of knowing if sending Ether to the contract will result in a valid deposit or your funds disappearing in to the void.

author: yorickdowne
content:
As a user, not affiliated with any client efforts, "we are ready" may be right for Teku, but when I look at Prysm, it needs to bake in Medalla's heat some more. Just today it fell over (can't deliver attestations successfully all the time, only some of the time) once the exit queue grew.
I fully expect it'll be in much better shape a week from now, and even better shape a week after that. And, that's been the story for that particular client ever since day 2 of non-finality.

author: yorickdowne
content: To be clear: The Prysm team is doing amazing work and the client from `master` today is nothing like the client on Oct 13th. So much progress. And - it needs a few more weeks of that progress, and then it needs to prove itself stable.
